Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add interactive frontend for CoD seeding simulation

Build complete web interface for exploring playoff seeding scenarios:
- Probability table showing playoff/seeding percentages for all teams
- Interactive game boxes with score inputs for upcoming matches
- Real-time simulation triggered by user score adjustments
- Professional dark-themed UI with color-coded probabilities

Frontend Components:
- HTML two-section layout \(table top, games bottom\)
- JavaScript API client for Flask backend communication
- Table renderer with rank highlighting and probability color coding
- Game box system with best-of-5 score validation
- Main app coordinator with state management

Features:
- Responsive design for mobile/tablet/desktop
- Loading states with animated spinner
- Error handling and inline validation
- Visual feedback \(blue borders for adjusted games, red for invalid\)
- Keyboard shortcuts \(Ctrl+Enter to simulate, Escape to reset\)

Also includes Flask app.py with CORS support and comprehensive API tests.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add comprehensive README documentation

Create detailed README.md with:
- Project overview and feature highlights
- Quick start installation and usage instructions
- API endpoint documentation with examples
- Data format specifications
- Technical architecture details
- Performance metrics and benchmarks
- Complete project structure
- Development and debugging guides

Includes badges, code examples, and clear sections for both users
and developers.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add development log documenting project journey

Create LOG.md chronicling the complete development process:
- Timestamped entry for 2026-02-07
- Detailed phase-by-phase development breakdown \(Phases 1-5\)
- Key decisions and architecture choices documented
- Performance metrics and test results for each phase
- Challenge highlights and solutions
- Summary statistics \(code metrics, performance, features\)
- Future enhancement ideas for reference

Provides historical context for project evolution, distinct from
README which focuses on current state and usage.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
